blocks.text: An organization protecting sensitive data might use preventive controls such as encryption and access restrictions, detective controls such as log monitoring, and corrective controls such as automated system restoration.
Physical security may include guards, locked server rooms, and surveillance systems, while operational security includes employee training and incident response drills.
When a system cannot be patched immediately, temporary compensating controls such as additional firewall rules or network segmentation may be used until permanent fixes are applied.
Security programs must continuously adapt controls as threats, business needs, and technologies change.
